title: Q1 2025: A Surprisingly Strong Start for Games
description: An analytical recap of Q1 2025’s most notable game releases — from standout indies to rocky AAA launches.

title: Weekly Notes: April 7–13, 2025
description: A look at some of the standout releases and review trends from the second week of April 2025 — including Crashlands 2, Blue Prince, and more.

title: Weekly Notes (April 14–20): Surprise Hits and RTS Flashbacks
description: This week’s notes include RuneScape: Dragonwilds, a surprise DLC success, and a Command & Conquer throwback with Tempest Rising.

title: Weekly Notes (April 21–27): A Great Week for RPG Fans
description: This week’s notes include Oblivion Remastered, Clair Obscur’s strong debut which creates a great week for RPGs

title: Weekly Notes (April 28 - May 04): Builds, Cozy Catastrophes, and Audience Anomalies
description: Roguelite shooters, fashion RPGs, and Diablo-likes walk into Early Access. Here's what happened — and what players really thought, language by language.

title: Weekly Notes (May 5–11): Indie Wins, Franchise Fails, and a Claymation Surprise
description: A claymation adventure from Gothenburg, literal money laundering, and multiple big-name DLCs with rough launches. Here's what Steam players actually thought - language by language.

title: Weekly Notes (May 12–18): Why DOOM Dominated - and Slormancer Struggled Across Asia
description: Fast-paced FPS, nostalgic Flash revivals, and ARPGs struggling to communicate - this week’s game releases reveal what players love and what drives them away

title: Weekly Notes (May 19–25): Sequels, Surprises & Slow-Life RPGs
description: From Fantasy Life i's slow-life charm to Monster Train 2’s triumphant sequel, and a curious Brazilian surge for 9 Kings - here’s what stood out on Steam this week.

title: Weekly Notes (May 26 – Jun 01): Elden Ring Nightreign Turbulence, Kabuto Park Buzz & May’s Top Releases
description: From Elden Ring Nightreign’s rocky launch to Kabuto Park’s near-perfect debut—dive into this week’s top Steam releases and May’s complete leaderboard.

title: Weekly Notes (Jun 02 – Jun 08): Dune, DELTARUNE, and a Farming-RPG Split
description: A closer look at Dune: Awakening’s Advanced Access performance, DELTARUNE’s long-awaited Steam release, and how Rune Factory splits its audience nearly 50/50 between English and Chinese players. Plus more from this week’s top launches and demos.

title: Weekly Notes (Jun 09 – Jun 15): Showdowns, Clones, and Controversies
description: This week, we look at Stellar Blade’s successful PC debut, the polarizing stealth horror of FNAF: Secret of the Mimic, and 11 bit studios’ philosophical survival game The Alters. Plus: a troubled launch for MindsEye, a nostalgic WW2 shooter, and Steam Next Fest demos

title: Weekly Notes (Jun 16 – Jun 22): Roots, Chinese Revenge Dramas & Co-op Chaos
description: A packed week of Steam releases, including the Roots DLC launch for Songs of Conquest, a hit narrative game from China, Landfall’s new viral co-op title, and Remedy’s new co-op game

title: Weekly Notes (Jun 23 – Jun 29): A Quiet Week, But Some Interesting Drops
description: This week on Steam saw fewer big releases, but cozy aquariums, a Persona F2P spinoff, a classic remaster, and a tiny shipping empire kept things interesting.

title: Weekly Notes (Jun 30 – Jul 06): Summer Lulls and Niklas Notes Updates
description: The Steam Summer Sale quieted releases this week, so I’m sharing what I’ve been building behind the scenes on Niklas Notes, from genre tagging improvements to advanced search, PDF reports, and what’s next.

title: Weekly Notes (July 07 – 13): RimWorld Soars, Patapon Returns, Mycopunk Delivers Co-op Chaos
description: The Steam Summer Sale is over, but launches didn’t slow down. This week’s breakdown covers RimWorld’s new DLC, a co-op surprise in Mycopunk, rhythm nostalgia with Patapon, and more.

title: Q2 2025: What Grabbed Player Attention (and Where)
description: This quarterly breakdown looks at Q2 2025’s most talked-about games on Steam—by language, region, and review trends. From global hits like Clair Obscur to region-locked remasters, here’s what got players talking (or rage-reviewing)
tags: The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion Remastered
The Last of Us Part II Remastered

title: Weekly Notes (July 14 – 20): Destiny Stumbles, Indies Shine, Nostalgia Returns
description: This week brought a mix of the old and the new—Destiny's latest expansion got a rocky reception, while games like Eriksholm and Word Play charmed their audiences.

title: Weekly Notes (July 21 – 27): When Performance Kills the Hype
description: This week's biggest releases struggled with technical issues while smaller games found success through solid execution and unique mechanics

title: Weekly Notes (July 28 – Aug 03): Sequels, Nostalgia & Second Breakfast in the Shire
description: Big names, small stumbles. This week saw Grounded 2, Titan Quest II, and Tales of the Shire return to familiar worlds - sometimes with performance issues in tow

title: Weekly Notes (Aug 04 – Aug 10): Mafia Returns to the Old Country and Puzzle Perfection by Managing Expectations
description: Mafia returns with familiar issues, while smaller games like Is This Seat Taken? show how to nail expectations. Plus performance problems continue to plague major releases.

title: Weekly Notes (Aug 11 – Aug 17): The Bazaar's Growing Pains and OFF's Long-Awaited Return
description: The Bazaar faces monetization backlash while OFF makes its official Steam debut after 17 years. Plus Dawn of War gets the definitive treatment.

title: Weekly Notes (Aug 18 – Aug 24): The Gamescom Effect and Corporate Satire
description: The Gamescom Effect kept releases light, though Stick It to the Stickman's workplace humor and Chinese narrative games proved there's always room for the right content.

title: Weekly Notes (Aug 25 – Aug 31): Naked Snake, Missing Split-screen co-op and Regional Opinions about Jumping
description: Metal Gear Solid Δ and Gears of War remasters headline the week, while Shinobi reveals stark regional divides. Plus - Story of Seasons (formerly Harvest Moon) returns

title: Weekly Notes (Sep 01 – 07): Silksong Finally Arrives (and Crashes Steam)
description: Hollow Knight: Silksong dominates the week but faces Chinese localization controversy. Plus: survival horror from Bloober Team, NBA 2K26's monetization woes, and two Early Access graduates.

title: Weekly Notes (Sep 08 – 14): Borderlands 4 Tests the Limits of Recommended Specs
description: Borderlands 4 launches at 64% positive despite high system requirements. Plus: A full motion interactive fiction for the chinese audience climbs the toplist, and someone made another game about digging holes and more!

title: Weekly Notes (Sep 15 – 21): From Zombie Parkour to Brewery Management
description: Dying Light: The Beast brings Kyle Crane back for revenge. Eight games graduate from Early Access in a single week. Plus: psychological horror, free-to-play skating, and cozy city building.

title: Weekly Notes (Sep 22 – 28): Gods and Karts - Hades II and Sonic Racing Lead the Week
description: Hades II exits Early Access alongside Slime Rancher 2. Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds hits 96% positive as a real Mario Kart PC competitor. Silent Hill f divides fans. Plus: EA FC 26 struggles and a gambling roguelite

title: Weekly Notes (Sep 29 – Oct 5): Final Fantasy Tactics and Digimon Lead a Quiet Week
description: A quieter week as developers avoid the Steam Autumn Sale. Final Fantasy Tactics remake, Digimon Story, Train Sim World 6, and more. Plus: Top releases for all of September.

title: Weekly Notes (Oct 06 – Oct 12): Battlefield 6 Hits 700k Players, Little Nightmares III Disappoints
description: Battlefield 6 launches to 700k concurrent players and positive reviews. Little Nightmares III stumbles with Mixed reviews. Plus: HoMM Olden Era demo, narrative indie CARIMARA, and Early Access graduates.
tags: Heroes of Might and Magic Olden Era
Lost Eidolons Veil of the Witch

title: Weekly Notes (Oct 13 – 19): Steam Next Fest Brings Demos and Duck-Based Extraction Shooter
description: Escape From Duckov is the winner this week with its extraction shooter. BALL x PIT follows Megabonk's success. Fellowship launches in Early Access. Plus: 30+ Steam Next Fest demos analyzed.

title: Weekly Notes (Oct 20 – 26): Another Swedish Success Story & Bloodlines 2's Rocky Start
description: RV There Yet joins Sweden's growing list of breakout hits. Vampire: The Masquerade - Bloodlines 2 finally releases after 18 years but doesn't quite stick the landing. Plus: Ninja Gaiden 4 pre-orders, five Early Access graduates.

title: Weekly Notes (Oct 27 – Nov 02): ARC Raiders launch becomes a mega hit, Outer Worlds 2 Arrives
description: ARC Raiders from Stockholm reaches 300k daily users. The Outer Worlds 2 launches at 79% with improved companions. Battlefield REDSEC's Battle Royale pivot struggles. Plus: Master of Command, Escape Simulator 2, and CK3's Asia expansion

title: Weekly Notes (Nov 03 – Nov 09): A week with Strategy and Management, UI Criticisms & Tavern Keeper’s Warm Welcome
description: A big week for strategy and sim fans: Europa Universalis V lands strong, Football Manager 26 stumbles on UI, Tavern Keeper charms its way into Early Access, and a desktop auto-battler quietly crushes.

title: Weekly Notes (Nov 10 – Nov 16): Tarkov's Troubled Steam Debut & A Week of Mixed Launches
description: Escape from Tarkov stumbles onto Steam at 31% positive. Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 faces campaign criticism. Where Winds Meet impresses visually. Plus: Anno 117, Inazuma Eleven nostalgia, and Rue Valley's Disco Elysium vibes.

title: Weekly Notes (Nov 17 – Nov 23): Risk of Rain 2 DLC Tops the Charts & Strong Early Access Launches
description: Risk of Rain 2's Alloyed Collective DLC reaches Overwhelmingly Positive. Cleared Hot channels Desert Strike nostalgia. Moonlighter 2 returns to the shop. Plus: Mandate of Heaven, Monsters are Coming, and two Early Access graduates.

title: Weekly Notes (Nov 24 – Nov 30): Mount & Blade Gets Naval Warfare & Solo Leveling Arrives on Steam
description: Mount & Blade II: Bannerlord's long-awaited first DLC introduces naval warfare. Solo Leveling: ARISE OVERDRIVE brings the popular Korean web novel series to Steam. Plus: BLACK SOULS II, Of Ash and Steel, Constance, and more.

title: Weekly Notes (Dec 01 – Dec 07): Guild Wars Returns & ELDEN RING DLC Gets Mixed Reception
description: Guild Wars Reforged launches at 89% with nostalgia-driven praise. ELDEN RING NIGHTREIGN DLC hits 46% Mixed. ROUTINE impresses at 91%. Dungeon Rampage revival at 94%. Plus: OCTOPATH TRAVELER 0, Destiny 2 expansion, and seven Early Access graduates.

title: Weekly Notes (Dec 08 – Dec 14): Devolver's Skate Story Shines While Ashes of Creation Struggles
description: Skate Story's surreal glass demon skateboarding impresses with Blood Cultures soundtrack. Ashes of Creation's long-awaited MMORPG faces rough launch. UNBEATABLE and Bits & Bops bring strong rhythm game releases. Plus: Terminator 2D nostalgia and three Early Access graduates.

title: Weekly Notes (Dec 15 – Dec 21): Quiet Christmas Week with PIONER & Black Hole Clicker
description: A quiet Christmas week on Steam. PIONER launches in Early Access with server issues. A Game About Feeding A Black Hole brings dopamine-heavy incremental gameplay. Raiders of Blackveil faces always-online criticism. Plus: Mon Bazou and Swordhaven graduate Early Access.
tags: A Game About Feeding A Black Hole

title: Weekly Notes (Dec 22 – Dec 28): Year in Review & What's Next for Niklas Notes
description: The quietest week of 2025 becomes a look back at what's been built. New recommendation system, developer analytics, OAuth login, Stripe payments, review timeline improvements, and thoughts about the future

title: Weekly Notes (Dec 29 – Jan 04): Steam Awards 2025 - Did Sweden Just Win?
description: The 2025 Steam Awards results are in. Hollow Knight: Silksong wins GOTY, but the real story? Sweden took home 4 out of 11 awards. Full breakdown of all winners, nominees, and what the data shows.
